title: FAA Warns of Air Traffic Cuts Friday if Government Shutdown Continues
summary: The plan, which officials said was intended to help air traffic controllers, could force the cancellation of thousands of flights as the administration seeks to pressure Democrats to end the shutdown.

title: Lawmakers Seek Investigation of Judges Who Criticized Supreme Court
summary: The Republican leaders of the Senate and House Judiciary Committees told Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. that anonymous judges who responded to a Times questionnaire may have violated ethics rules.

title: Judge Berates Justice Dept. in Its Prosecution of Comey
summary: The flashpoint was the Justice Department’s failure to turn over seized communications from a confidant of Mr. Comey’s, Daniel C. Richman, a law professor at Columbia University.

title: Democrats Raise Concerns After Trump Officials Give Boat Strikes Briefing
summary: The classified meeting did not relieve mounting unease among lawmakers over President Trump’s expanding campaign of lethal strikes against drug cartels.

title: An Emboldened Mamdani Sheds Conciliatory Tone
summary: Fresh from a stunning victory, Zohran Mamdani, the mayor-elect, said in an interview that his supporters wanted “a politics of consistency” and aggressive action, including on taxing the rich.

title: Trump vs. Mamdani: President Sees a Capable Foil in New York’s Next Mayor
summary: President Trump has berated Zohran Mamdani, the mayor-elect of New York City, in public. But privately, Mr. Trump describes him as slick and a good talker.

title: Mamdani Begins to Pick the Team That Will Help Him Run New York City
summary: Zohran Mamdani has been planning his mayoral transition for months and appears poised to hire veterans of city government to key posts in his administration.

title: Mamdani Won. South Florida Expects a Real Estate Bump.
summary: Some brokers and developers in the region are waiting eagerly to see if the election of a democratic socialist will drive more wealthy New Yorkers south.

title: Republicans Point Fingers After Election Losses, but Not at Trump
summary: Casting around for culprits, leaders in the party blamed their candidates, the government shutdown and a weak economic message.

title: UPS Plane’s Engine Detached Before Deadly Louisville Crash, Official Says
summary: The aircraft’s left engine fell off as the plane rolled toward takeoff, according to safety investigators. At least 12 people died after the plane plunged to the ground.

title: Can Melatonin Cause Heart Failure? What to Know About Claims of Health Risks.
summary: Headlines this week have raised alarms about the popular sleep supplement.

title: Would Elon Musk Work Harder for $1 Trillion Than $1 Billion?
summary: Economists and psychologists say that compensation may not provide as powerful an incentive as is often assumed.

title: Key Justices Cast a Skeptical Eye on Trump’s Tariffs
summary: The Supreme Court is considering whether the president acted legally when he used a 1977 emergency statute to impose tariffs on scores of countries.

title: Five Key Takeaways From the Supreme Court Tariff Argument
summary: The Supreme Court justices grappled with the legality of President Trump’s tariffs in an oral argument that stretched for almost three hours.

title: Mexico’s President Presses Charges Against Man Who Groped Her on the Street
summary: A video of a man touching Mexico’s first female president, Claudia Sheinbaum, shocked many Mexicans but did not surprise them. “It’s so common,” one woman said.

title: Analysis Finds Global Warming Made Hurricane Melissa More Damaging
summary: Climate change enabled the storm to churn faster and grow more quickly, a rapid analysis found.

title: The Greatest Breakfast Sandwich May Be the One With Pastrami
summary: New York City has been overlooking the obvious all along.

title: The Indispensable Erdogan
summary: Western capitals should be wary of treating democracy in Turkey as a luxury rather than a necessity.

title: Sudan Is in Free Fall
summary: The slaughter in Darfur could potentially be stopped, if those with leverage chose to act.

title: In China, Victims of Abuse Are Told to ‘Keep It in the Family’
summary: Cases of domestic violence in China point to a legal system that looks good on paper but is failing victims because of a lack of resources and political will.

title: Radiation May Be Unnecessary for Many Breast Cancer Patients
summary: Doctors have already begun reducing radiation treatment for women at low risk of recurrence or spread of the disease. A new study finds that some women at greater risk can safely avoid radiation.

title: Remains of the Last American Hostage Held in Gaza Returned to Israel
summary: Israeli officials told Itay Chen’s family last year that he was probably killed on Oct. 7, 2023, but relatives put off mourning until his body had come home.

title: Heavy Drinkers Develop Strokes Earlier, Study Shows
summary: New research examined the link between alcohol and brain bleeds.
